answers.text: only when the product is needed

qas.question: What are examples of a cell's external environment?

answers.text: available nutrients, temperature and other stresses

qas.question: What are examples of a cell's internal environment?

answers.text: cell division cycle, metabolism, infection status

qas.question: At which step can gene expression be regulated?
What example of post-translational modification of a protein was first described in 1961?

answers.text: The regulation of lactose metabolism genes in E. coli

context: Genes are regulated so that they are expressed <a0_0>only when the product is needed<a0_0/>, since expression draws on limited resources.:7 A cell regulates its gene expression depending on its external environment (e.g. <a1_0>available nutrients, temperature and other stresses<a1_0/>), its internal environment (e.g. <a2_0>cell division cycle, metabolism, infection status<a2_0/>), and its specific role if in a multicellular organism. Gene expression can be regulated <a3_0>at any step<a3_0/>: from transcriptional initiation, to RNA processing, to post-translational modification of the protein. <a4_0>The regulation of lactose metabolism genes in E. coli<a4_0/> (lac operon) was the first such mechanism to be described in 1961.
